The Lion tennis team competed against Melissa on Tuesday night. Overall, the Lions won 15-4. In doubles, the team jumped to a 6-1 lead with huge wins coming at line ones on both sides. The boys were led by Cristian Gutierrez and Vicente Sipriano while the ladies were represented by Yadira Rodriguez and Emily Rodriguez.

In singles, the ladies swept in all six matches. Several of the matches went to third-set super tiebreakers with Kaufman proving victorious. On the night, Cristian Gutierrez and Emily James were the MVPs.

Heart Awards went to Yadira Rodriguez, Natalya Morales, Vicente Sipriano, and Kayden Lengacher for winning third set breakers. Low Scorer award went to Jackie Rodriguez who made small work of her opponents.

This improves the team record to 3-0 on the season. Kaufman will be playing in an intersquad scrimmage on Friday.

Kaufman ISD’s own Margarita Garcia was recently selected as one of only eight individuals state-wide to receive the 2020 Texas B.E.S.T. Award.

This award reflects Mrs. Garcia’s commitment to excellence in the field of service and education and stands as a dual recognition for her alma mater: Baptist University of the Americas.

Also, Region 10 chose their elementary and secondary “Teacher of the Year” representatives for each district.

We congratulate Mrs. Tonya Lowder of Nash Elementary, who believes that “educating children is the best way to make a difference in this world” and Mr. Steven Bucholtz of Kaufman High School, who believes that “all kids have potential brilliance. Our job is to help them find it.”

Their pictures will be hanging on the wall of honor at Region 10 this year and their principals and Dr. Blaylock stopped by this morning to congratulate them and give them their yard signs.

We are proud to have these three KISD employees recognized and honored as ambassadors of hard work for our district.

To the students and community of KISD,

The tragic death of George Floyd and the shocking scenes from Minneapolis and across the country have impacted all of us. We hear and acknowledge the range of emotions our students, staff, and community are experiencing. No student in our schools and no citizens in our community should ever be marginalized, targeted, or victimized.

Individual students, staff, and community members have the freedom to choose their response to these events. Some feel led to peaceful protest, others are led to prayer. All responses should be respected as long as violence and lawlessness are not present.

The KISD Administration is not a political organization. However, we ARE committed to listening and continually learning from one another. We see students who genuinely care for each other and stand in solidarity. We also see students who are experiencing emotional distress. Individual students who feel the need to talk to a counselor should contact the school. We will listen.

The Mane Attraction is the “Show Choir” for Kaufman High School. A show choir is a performance group which combines choral singing with choreographed movement or dance.

The Mane Attraction performs at many concerts throughout the year. They also perform at pep rallies and community events. Show Choir is scheduled 5th period every day.
Students in 9-12 grades are encouraged to audition to be a part of this entertaining group.

Procedures for auditions:
Submit a video of yourself singing a pop song of your choice. In order to be chosen for The Mane Attraction, you need to be an independent singer (comfortable singing alone). The ability to sing and dance at the same time is necessary. In your video, show choreographed movement for at least some of the song.
Send videos to tcollins@kaufman-isd.net. Audition deadline is Friday, May 15th.

Tuesday night, our Kaufman Lions took on the Mt. Pleasant Tigers in the third round of the playoffs. We're incredibly thankful for those who made the trip to Tyler to watch our boys! Tuesday's game was a perfect example of the fighting spirit of our team. The first half was a battle that found our Lions trailing by six points. In the second half, our Lions found themselves in a tough situation and ended up trailing by 21 at one point. However, our Lions found a spark and did what they've done all season, and they battled back! The excitement was capped off as Joseph McCray rebounded a missed free throw by the Tigers with six seconds remaining. McCray raced up court and buried a three-pointer as time expired to send the game to overtime. Our boys came up a little short in the extra period, losing 53-56, but they came up huge in heart, fearlessness, and determination. Way to go, boys, it was an amazing season!
